name: Gabon
description: Gabon, officially the Republic of Gabon, is a country located along the Atlantic coast and bordered by Equatorial Guinea, Cameroon, and the Republic of Congo. Known for its dense rainforests, stunning beaches, and diverse wildlife, Gabon is a biodiversity hotspot and a significant player in the timber and oil industries. It’s a nation striving to balance economic development with the preservation of its natural heritage.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The bustling capital city and economic center of Gabon.
quickFacts.detail: Libreville is situated on the coast and offers a mix of modern infrastructure and traditional Gabonese culture.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Gabon's population is primarily concentrated along the coast.
quickFacts.detail: The majority of the population identifies as Fang or Myene ethnic groups.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Gabon is the fourth-smallest country in Africa.
quickFacts.detail: Approximately 80% of the country is covered by rainforest.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: French is the official language of Gabon.
quickFacts.detail: Gabonese Pygmy languages are also spoken.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: The currency of Gabon is the West African CFA franc.
quickFacts.detail: Gabon is closely tied to the CFA franc zone.

quickFacts.label: GDP
quickFacts.description: Gabon's economy is largely driven by oil and timber exports.
quickFacts.detail: The country is a member of OPEC.

climateData.title: Climate of Gabon
climateData.description: Gabon experiences a tropical rainforest climate, characterized by high temperatures and humidity throughout the year. Rainfall is abundant and distributed relatively evenly, with a distinct wet and dry season.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Wet Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The wet season brings heavy rainfall, flooding, and increased humidity. Rivers swell, and travel can be challenging.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Dry Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The dry season offers lower rainfall and more pleasant temperatures. Wildlife is more concentrated around water sources.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Transition Seasons
seasonalCharacteristics.description: These periods see a gradual shift in weather patterns, with increasing rainfall towards the end of September and decreasing rainfall towards the end of February.
activities: Diverse activities depending on the specific conditions

naturalWonders.name: Loango National Park
naturalWonders.description: Loango National Park is a UNESCO World Heritage Site renowned for its unique 'forest-savanna' ecosystem. It’s home to hippos, elephants, gorillas, and diverse birdlife, all found in a relatively undisturbed environment.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The park’s coastline offers stunning beaches and opportunities for wildlife viewing. The combination of rainforest and savanna creates a truly exceptional habitat.

naturalWonders.name: Ivindo National Park
naturalWonders.description: Ivindo National Park is a vast expanse of pristine rainforest, offering a glimpse into Gabon’s untouched wilderness. It’s a critical habitat for gorillas and other endangered species.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The park’s river system provides a vital corridor for wildlife movement. The dense vegetation and abundant rainfall create a truly immersive rainforest experience.
viewingTips: Hire a local guide for optimal wildlife viewing

naturalWonders.name: Tsodoba National Park
naturalWonders.description: Tsodoba National Park is a significant area for primate conservation, particularly for the critically endangered mountain gorillas of Central Africa. It’s also home to a diverse array of other wildlife and plant life.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The park’s ancient volcanic landscape provides a unique backdrop for wildlife viewing. The rainforest is characterized by towering trees and lush vegetation.
viewingTips: Book gorilla trekking permits in advance

biodiversityCategory.name: Rainforest Biodiversity
biodiversityCategory.description: Gabon’s rainforest is one of the most biodiverse ecosystems on Earth, harboring a remarkable array of plant and animal species.

statistics.details: Gabon boasts an exceptionally high diversity of tree species, many of which are endemic.
The country is a haven for birdwatchers, with numerous endemic and migratory species.
Gabon’s rainforest supports a wide range of mammals, including gorillas, elephants, and forest pigs.

notableSpecies.name: Cross River Gorilla
notableSpecies.significance: One of the last remaining populations of this iconic primate.

notableSpecies.name: Gabon King Pigeon
notableSpecies.significance: A unique pigeon species found only in Gabon.

notableSpecies.name: Black Panther
notableSpecies.significance: A highly elusive and sought-after predator.

ecosystemData.title: Gabon’s Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Gabon’s ecosystems are remarkably diverse, ranging from dense rainforests to coastal wetlands and savanna grasslands. These ecosystems are vital for the country’s biodiversity and economy.

biodiversityCategories.name: Rainforest Biodiversity
biodiversityCategories.description: As described above, Gabon’s rainforest is a global biodiversity hotspot.

biodiversityCategories.name: Coastal Ecosystems
biodiversityCategories.description: Gabon’s coastline is characterized by mangrove forests, coral reefs, and sandy beaches.

statistics.details: Mangroves provide critical habitat for fish and other marine life.

notableSpecies.name: Green Turtle
notableSpecies.significance: A key species for Gabon’s coastal ecosystem.

activities.title: Activities in Gabon
activities.description: Gabon offers a wide range of activities for nature lovers and adventure seekers, from wildlife viewing to water sports.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore Gabon’s rainforests and mountains on foot.

activities.name: Mount Cameroon Trek
activities.description: A challenging trek to the summit of Mount Cameroon, offering stunning views.
activities.requirements: Good fitness level, hiking boots, rain gear

activities.name: Tsodoba Trail
activities.description: Explore the trails of Tsodoba National Park, searching for gorillas and other wildlife.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy Gabon’s beautiful coastline with a variety of water sports.

activities.name: Dolphin Watching
activities.description: Observe dolphins in their natural habitat.

activities.name: Snorkeling & Diving
activities.description: Explore Gabon’s coral reefs and marine life.

clothing.yearRound: Insect repellent, hat, comfortable walking shoes
